Article Title: IPL Auction 2026's most expensive buys: From Cameron Green to Prashant Veer
Article Text:
Prashant Veer Singh and Cameron Green (Image credit: Agencies)

KKR CEO Venky Mysore Explains Cameron Green Buy - 'We were getting close to the limit'

IPL Auction 2026: Most expensive buys



Player Team Price (In Rs crore) Cameron Green Kolkata Knight Riders 25.20 Matheesha Pathirana Kolkata Knight Riders 18.00 Prashant Veer Chennai Super Kings 14.20 Kartik Sharma Chennai Super Kings 14.20 Aaqib Dar Delhi Capitals 8.40 Ravi Bishnoi Rajasthan Royals 7.20 Venkatesh Iyer Royal Challengers Bengaluru 7.00

NEW DELHI: Franchises opened their purses freely at the IPL 2026 auction in Abu Dhabi, splashing big money to secure their preferred targets. Kolkata Knight Riders stole the spotlight by spending a record Rs 25.20 crore to sign Australian all-rounder Cameron Green , while also shelling out Rs 18 crore to rope in Sri Lankan fast bowler Matheesha Pathirana during Tuesday‚Äôs proceedings.Uncapped Indian players also commanded significant attention, with Uttar Pradesh‚Äôs 20-year-old left-arm spinner Prashant Veer emerging as one of the biggest winners. Chennai Super Kings snapped him up for Rs 14.20 crore, making him the highest-paid uncapped player in IPL auction history after he entered the auction at a base price of Rs 30 lakh.Another major gainer was Jammu and Kashmir pacer Auqib Nabi Dar, who was bought by Delhi Capitals for Rs 8.40 crore.Dar, too, had a base price of Rs 30 lakh and featured prominently among the standout uncapped buys of the mini auction.Green‚Äôs signing rewrote the record books as he went past fellow Australian Mitchell Starc‚Äôs previous overseas mark of Rs 24.75 crore to become the most expensive overseas player in IPL auction history. The all-rounder attracted a fierce bidding war between Kolkata Knight Riders and Chennai Super Kings, with KKR eventually prevailing.KKR were also involved in the race for India all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer but withdrew as Royal Challengers Bengaluru secured him for Rs 7 crore.Pathirana, who entered the auction at a base price of Rs 2 crore, went on to become the most expensive Sri Lankan ever sold at an IPL auction.Green has previously represented Mumbai Indians and Royal Challengers Bengaluru and has featured in 29 IPL matches, scoring 707 runs and picking up 16 wickets.
Article Summary: Kolkata knight riders spend record rs 25.20 crore to sign australian all-rounder cameron green. Sri lankan fast bowler matheesha pathirana becomes the most expensive sri lanka player ever sold at an ipl auction. Uttar pradesh‚Äôs 20-year-old left-arm spinner prashant veer emerges as one of the biggest winners.

Article Title: ‚ÄòWaiting in vain‚Äô: Tharoor reacts to IND-SA match cancellation; cites Kerala's AQI
Article Text:
Shashi Tharoor (PTI image)

NEW DELHI: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday questioned the decision to host the fourth India‚ÄìSouth Africa T20I in Lucknow amid dense fog and severe air pollution, after the match was eventually called off due to poor visibility.Tharoor suggested the game should have been scheduled in Thiruvananthapuram, citing significantly better air quality conditions there.In a post on X, the Congress leader said cricket fans were ‚Äúwaiting in vain‚Äù as hazardous conditions stalled play.‚ÄúCricket fans have been waiting in vain for the #INDVSSAODI to start in Lucknow. But thanks to dense smog, pervasive in most north Indian cities, and an AQI of 411, visibility is too poor to permit a game of cricket. They should‚Äôve scheduled the game in Thiruvananthapuram, where AQI is about 68 right now!‚Äù he wrote.India was scheduled to play the fourth match of the five-T20I series against South Africa at the Ekana Cricket Stadium. However, the toss was repeatedly delayed as thick fog enveloped the venue, forcing umpires to conduct multiple ground inspections through the evening.Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav also targeted the Centre, linking the cancellation of the Lucknow match to the city‚Äôs deteriorating air quality.He alleged that the government‚Äôs policies were worsening the situation and blamed them for making conditions unsafe for players and spectators.In a post on X he wrote: "Delhi's pollution has now reached Lucknow as well. That's why the international cricket match scheduled to be held in Lucknow is not taking place. Actually, the reason for this is not fog, but smog. The parks that we had built for Lucknow's pure air, the BJP government wants to ruin them too by organizing investment events there. BJP members are neither kin to humans nor to the environment. Cover your face because you are in Lucknow. "Fans expressed their disappointment following the announcement of match cancellation.With visibility failing to improve even after several assessments, match officials eventually called off the game. Both teams remained in their dressing rooms for most of the evening as conditions worsened after sunset.The fifth and final match between the two countries will be played at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Friday.The India Meteorological Department had earlier issued an orange alert for very dense fog in several parts of Uttar Pradesh, with visibility at the stadium severely affected.Former cricketers on the broadcast had warned that delaying the start could make it even harder to complete the match, as fog typically intensifies later in winter evenings.The washout came as an added setback for India, with vice-captain Shubman Gill ruled out of the match due to a toe injury sustained during training. Sanju Samson was expected to open the innings in his absence.India continues to lead the five-match series 2‚Äì1 against South Africa.
Article Summary: Congress mp shashi tharoor questions decision to host fourth india‚Äìsouth africa t20i in lucknow. The match was eventually called off due to poor visibility and severe air pollution. The fifth and final match between the two countries will be played at the narendra modi stadium in ahmedabad.

Article Title: Jalen Brunson‚Äôs net worth: Exploring New York Knicks star‚Äôs assets and endorsements as he wins NBA Cup MVP award
Article Text:
Jalen Brunson's net worth explored (Image via NBA)

Exploring Jalen Brunson‚Äôs NBA salary and contract

Details of Jalen Brunson‚Äôs endorsements and deals

One of the most consistent point guards in the league, Jalen Brunson was once an under-the-radar second-round pick. Still making a move upwards in compensation and on-court production, the 28-year-old guard is in his seventh season and has largely established himself as the leader of the New York Knicks.The Dallas Mavericks drafted Brunson as the 33rd overall pick in the second round of the 2018 NBA draft. He moved to the New York Knicks ahead of the 2022‚Äì2023 season. In the middle of 2024, Jalen had an amazing postseason. All of Brunson's collaborations, rewards, and public appearance increase simultaneously with his profile. Additionally, he recently received the honor the NBA Cup MVP award.His career continues to ascend‚Äîdue to playoff performances, a lucrative contract, and consistent sponsor roles off the playing floor. This also represents a transition taking place within the league itself; there is a greater appreciation for leadership and sound guard play on the dressing room floor and behind the negotiating table.His jerseys sported the Villanova University colors on the basketball floor from 2015 to 2018 before he found his fit in the NBA after being picked by the Dallas Mavericks during the second-round pick of the 2018 NBA Draft at the position of the 33rd overall pick.Brunson's stint with the Knicks since his trade in 2022 had him emerging as a distinct offensive menace on the basketball floor.He has been a reliable player in the New York Knicks' lineup constantly during the seasons from 2022-23 to the current 2023-24 season. He has made it to the NBA All-Star game twice while playing with the Knicks and is now performing better than ever in the current season.Brunson joined the Knicks on a multi-year deal on July 12, 2022, after the Mavericks opted not to extend his contract.His financial path solidifies him within the ranks of the most popular guards within the NBA today. Forbes estimates that when he turns 28, in 2025, his net worth would be at least $2 million, solidifying him not just as the best but also as an intriguing brand on and off the court.After agreeing to a long-term contract with the Knicks and receiving numerous All-Star selections, Brunson's contribution to New York's revitalization has established him as a well-known figure in the league due to his leadership and expanding endorsement following.Jalen Brunson has partnered with a wide range of brands off the floor. Nike, American Express, Dollar Shave Club, Hecho Tequila Soda, MSI Computers, Faherty Brand, DoorDash, BodyArmor, and Pedialyte are some of his endorsement partners. His increasing prominence as a reliable performer and a media-friendly character is reflected in these collaborations.Although the numbers on those endeavours are still unknown, Brunson has also taken early steps in personal investment and brand development. The main sources of Jalen Brunson's wealth include his lucrative New York Knicks contracts, high-profile endorsement deals with companies like Nike, American Express, DoorDash, BodyArmor, Oura Ring, and Dunkin', as well as his expanding media presence.With a projected net worth of over $2 million in 2025, his Second Round Foundation is an important charity asset, and his astute contract decisions and marketability make him a major financial figure in the NBA.Also read: "An unbelievable experience"- Dylan Harper reflects on tough NBA Cup Final loss as young San Antonio Spurs learn hard lessons against New York Knicks
Article Summary: Jalen brunson was drafted by the dallas mavericks as the 33rd overall pick in the 2018 nba draft. He moved to the new york knicks ahead of the 2022‚Äì2023 season. He has been a reliable player in the knicks' lineup constantly during the seasons from 2022-23 to the current 2023-24 season.

Article Title: NBA injury update: Ja Morant‚Äôs status in doubt again as Memphis Grizzlies face Minnesota Timberwolves on the road
Article Text:
Ja Morant is now facing issues (Image via NBA)

Ja Morant‚Äôs latest ankle setback adds uncertainty as Memphis Grizzlies await his return to full form

Ja Morant‚Äôs injury concerns and absences continue to shape Memphis Grizzlies‚Äô outlook against Minnesota

The Memphis Grizzlies will play the Minnesota Timberwolves on the road once more. Guard Ja Morant of the Memphis Grizzlies is back on the injury list ahead of the team's Wednesday night game against the Minnesota Timberwolves. Due to an ankle injury he sustained on Monday night against the Los Angeles Clippers, Morant is now categorized as questionable.Morant finished the game with 12 points, three rebounds, and four assists while playing just 20:58. Morant's ankle issue was a tweak, according to Grizzlies head coach Tuomas Iisalo, and the team is hoping it's not catastrophic.Before making his comeback for last Friday's game against the Utah Jazz, Memphis Grizzlies point guard Ja Morant had been sidelined since mid-November. But since then, Morant has experienced yet another setback due to an ankle injury.After missing the fourth quarter of a Grizzlies victory over the Los Angeles Clippers on December 15 due to a left ankle strain, guard Ja Morant was downgraded to doubtful. Based on Morant's questionable tag for this game, it appears he avoided a long-term issue.As of December 17, his status is still uncertain. After stepping on another player's foot late in the fourth quarter of Monday's 121-103 victory over the Clippers, Morant sustained the injury.In just his second game back from a calf injury, the Grizzlies star was limited in how many minutes he could play. Morant finished the game against the Clippers with 12 points on 4-of-12 shooting, 4 assists, and 3 rebounds. Morant, a two-time All-Star, hasn't yet reached his best during the 2025‚Äì26 campaign.After missing ten straight games due to a left calf strain, Morant's return to the starting lineup on Monday was only his second. Due to a sprain on the same ankle, Morant had also missed time during the preseason.He is now shooting 35.7 percent from the field and 19.4 percent from 3-point range while averaging just 17.7 points, 3.5 rebounds, and 7.5 assists per game. If Morant is to return to his All-Star form from a few seasons ago, his shooting stats must improve. In addition to Spencer's absence, Vince Williams Jr. would probably start if Morant couldn't make it.Due to a number of ailments, the Grizzlies point guard has only made 14 appearances this season. Morant has averaged 17.7 points, 7.5 assists, and 3.5 rebounds in those games, but his field goal percentage is only 35.7%.On Tuesday night, Memphis was the 8.5-point underdog in this game; however, the odds have now changed to Grizzlies +7.5 at DraftKings, with Morant labelled as doubtful.Cam Spencer is out for personal reasons, so Memphis will play without him. Spencer has been a significant offensive spark, hitting 63.6% from three-point range and scoring in double digits in each of his last ten games. Given that the Grizzlies decided not to play Monday's hero on Wednesday due to personal circumstances, that movement is noteworthy.Morant has only been in 14 games this season, and when he is in the lineup, the Grizzlies have a 5-9 record. After missing ten straight games due to a calf strain, Monday's game against the Clippers was only his second game back in action.Also read: Ja Morant trade update: Could Miami Heat be preparing a bold move for disgruntled Memphis Grizzlies star?
Article Summary: Memphis grizzlies point guard ja morant is doubtful for wednesday's game against the minnesota timberwolves. Morant suffered an ankle injury in monday's 121-103 victory over the los angeles clippers. The two-time all-star has been sidelined since mid-november with a calf strain.

Article Title: Caught on camera! 'Angry' Jasprit Bumrah snatches phone after fan ignores warning - WATCH
Article Text:
Jasprit Bumrah (AFP Photo)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Abhishek Sharma's sister is very proud of her brother, and India win

Here‚Äôs how the brief exchange unfolded:

Fan

Aapke saath hi jaunga sir mai

Bumrah

Phone gir gya aapka to mereko bolna nahi

Fan

Koi baat nahi sir

Bumrah

Watch the video here:

NEW DELHI: Jasprit Bumrah was involved in an incident with a fan after losing his temper at an airport, where he was standing in a check-in queue. A video of the episode has since gone viral on social media.The fan was recording a selfie video with the Indian pacer without seeking his permission. Bumrah initially warned the fan to stop, but when the request was ignored, he snatched the phone and threw it aside.[I‚Äôll go with you only, sir][If your phone falls, don‚Äôt blame me][That‚Äôs okay, sir]: CoolAfter issuing a stern warning, Bumrah took the phone away, bringing the situation to an end.Bumrah is currently part of India‚Äôs ongoing T20I series against South Africa. In the opening T20I in Cuttack, he picked up two wickets while conceding just 17 runs.However, in the second match in Mullanpur, the fast bowler went wicketless and gave away 45 runs.He missed the third T20I in Dharamshala after returning home for personal reasons, as confirmed by the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI).The fourth T20I is scheduled to be played at the Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium in Lucknow, while the fifth and final match will take place at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on December 19. India currently lead the series 2-1.
Article Summary: Jasprit bumrah was involved in an incident with a fan at an airport. The fast bowler was standing in a check-in queue when he lost his temper. A video of the episode has since gone viral on social media.

Article Title: ‚ÄúHe wasn‚Äôt for me‚Äù: Stephen Curry‚Äôs wife Ayesha Curry admits she never expected to fall for the NBA legend
Article Text:
Ayesha Curry opens up about the first time she met Stephen Curry.(Image via Getty Images)

Stephen Curry‚Äôs wife, Ayesha Curry, speaks about the first time she saw the NBA legend

Stephen Curry confesses about the moment he decided to marry Ayesha Curry

Stephen Curry and Ayesha Curry met each other long before he was drafted in the NBA and became one of the most popular and talented athletes in the world as well as in the league.While Stephen Curry‚Äôs marriage with Ayesha Curry has raised eyebrows over the years, she had confessed how she never thought the NBA legend will fall in love with her when they initially met.A few years ago, in December 2020, Stephen Curry‚Äôs wife, Ayesha Curry, opened up to PEOPLE about meeting the Golden State Warriors‚Äô star player for the first time when they were kids.ID@undefinedCaption not available.ID@undefinedCaption not available.ID@undefinedCaption not available.Stephen Curry‚Äôs wife, Ayesha Curry, said, ‚ÄúWe were just kids‚Ä¶.‚ÄùThe popular entrepreneur and chef added, ‚ÄúHe was the cute boy at church that all of the girls were obsessed with, so I made a generalization that maybe he wasn‚Äôt for me.‚ÄùTo this, Stephen Curry added, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt remember the exact first day I saw her‚Ä¶‚ÄùThe Golden State Warriors‚Äô star player continued, ‚ÄúThere was no wind blowing in her face with a backlight.‚ÄùWhile the two did meet when they were children because they were part of the same church, Stephen Curry and Ayesha Curry did not start dating until years later, when they became teenagers.After dating for a couple of years, Stephen Curry and Ayesha Curry got married in 2011 and went on to create a beautiful family with four children.Even though their marriage has attracted a lot of criticism over the years, Stephen Curry has always credited his wife in public for the success he has achieved.ID@undefinedCaption not available.ID@undefinedCaption not available.ID@undefinedCaption not available.A few days ago, as Stephen Curry promoted his new memoir Shot Ready, he spoke to PEOPLE about the moment he realised Ayesha Curry was the one for him.Stephen Curry said, ‚ÄúWe had just started dating, or about a year and some change in, and I was deciding whether I was gonna go to the draft or not‚Ä¶‚ÄùThe Golden State Warriors‚Äô star player added, ‚ÄúShe actually told me to stay in school because of how important finishing my degree was and the whole deal‚Ä¶‚ÄùStephen Curry continued, ‚ÄúThat conversation and the emotions that I got to share really just established the fact that she was gonna be my biggest supporter no matter what I did‚Ä¶‚ÄùAlso Read: ‚ÄúI've wanted to punch them‚Äù: Stephen Curry‚Äôs wife Ayesha Curry opens up about the anger she feels when women try to pursue the NBA legend
Article Summary: Ayesha curry opens up about the first time she met stephen curry. The two did meet when they were children because they were part of the same church. They started dating years later, when they became teenagers. After dating for a couple of years, the two got married in 2011.

Article Title: NBA insider reveals how Michael Jordan truly feels as he gets candid about regret and his broken ties with Scottie Pippen
Article Text:
Michael Jordan and Scottie Pippen (Image via: Getty Images)

How ‚ÄúThe Last Dance‚Äù changed everything as Michael Jordan and Scottie Pippen‚Äôs once-cordial relationship turns bitter after documentary fallout

Michael Jordan chooses disappointment over anger as his relationship with Scottie Pippen remains unhealed

The long-running issues between former basketball legends Michael Jordan and Scottie Pippen have come back into the spotlight, bringing up memories from their time together with the Chicago Bulls. Once considered a great duo, many people thought Jordan was just angry about what happened, but that may not be true.The former Chicago Bulls coach Phil Jackson said Bulls forward Michael Jordan felt more hurt than angry by Pippen‚Äôs comments, according to Sam Smith, a former Chicago Bulls player. Instead of reacting in public, Michael Jordan stayed quiet and accepted that their close relationship had slowly come to an end.During their time with the Chicago Bulls, Michael Jordan, along with Scottie Pippen, won 6 championships together. ‚ÄúI didn't win without Scottie Pippen. And that's why I consider him my best teammate of all-time‚Äù, Michael Jordan once went candid about his bond with Scottie Pippen. And while Michael Jordan didn't share a very close personal off-court relationship with his Bulls teammate, Scottie Pippen. But they maintained a cordial relationship with each other, years after their retirement.But their relationship deteriorated following the release of the documentary, ‚ÄúThe Last Dance‚Äù in 2020, which focused on Michael Jordan, placing him as the main figure of the Bulls‚Äô legacy.Scottie Pippen allegedly felt deeply hurt by how his legacy was showcased in the film, as he felt the filmmakers didn't do justice with the way his legacy was portrayed in the film. He also felt positioning Jordan as the central figure not only minimized the roles played by the other teammates but also that the documentary didn't fully show their shared success. Over time, that feeling turned into bitterness, leading Pippen to openly criticize Jordan and question his reputation as one of the NBA's greatest players.Over time, Scottie Pippen's relationship with Michael Jordan has worsened to the extent that it still hasn't healed yet. But Jordan‚Äôs response has been quite unexpected as he seemed to have been more disappointed by how Pippen has reacted to this entire matter rather than feeling mad.And it is quite remarkable on Michael Jordan's part as he has handled the entire situation with Scottie Pippen, that instead of seeing it as an open public fight, he took it as a personal loss, a loss of years of on-court partnership and a deeply personal friendship that he once shared with Pippen. And while the duo is held by shared games and moments of championships, their personal relationship remains distant even to this day, which reminds that shared success on the court doesn't always mean harmony off it.Also Read: NBA legend Michael Jordan‚Äôs 23XI Racing wins major antitrust battle in dramatic NASCAR trial
Article Summary: Michael jordan and scottie pippen won 6 championships together with the chicago bulls. Their relationship deteriorated after the release of the documentary, ‚Äúthe last dance‚Äù in 2020, which focused on michael jordan, placing him as the main figure of the bulls‚Äô legacy.

Article Title: Anthony Joshua spills beans on his success secret that can help him win in high-voltage fight against Jake Paul
Article Text:
Anthony Joshua (via Getty Images) Anthony Joshua (via Getty Images) Anthony Joshua (via Getty Images) Anthony Joshua (via Getty Images) Anthony Joshua (via Getty Images) 1

2

Anthony Joshua reveals focusing on prayer ahead of Jake Paul fight



Anthony Joshua is making one final push to become the undisputed heavyweight champion. That journey begins on Friday night against Jake Paul in Miami. The fight will be telecast live on Netflix and will go down in Joshua‚Äôs professional record. On paper, the matchup looks one-sided. Still, it offers Joshua a chance to reset after a recent tough loss and prepare for another title run.Joshua had originally planned a quiet fight against a little-known opponent around this time. Instead, he accepted a huge money bout against the YouTuber-turned-boxer. The former unified champion sees Paul as a stepping stone. More importantly, he sees this fight as a chance to settle into his new team and mindset after being knocked out by Daniel Dubois in his last outing.Anthony Joshua believes the biggest change in this phase of his career is not technical. It is spiritual. The British boxer revealed that prayer has become a major part of his preparation. He spoke about this during a media roundtable in Miami after a low-key open workout with his new team at LIV Nightclub.When asked what the biggest shift has been in his final run at gold, Joshua gave a simple answer.‚ÄúMaybe that I pray more. That‚Äôs important. And I learnt that from the team, the importance of prayer.So yeah, that‚Äôs important to me and I pray more now‚Äù, he replied.Joshua‚Äôs recent loss raised serious questions about his future, and the 34 year old knows time is limited. The Jake Paul fight may look like a sideshow to some fans. But for Joshua, it is a fresh start. It allows him to work with new people and test changes under bright lights without immediate title pressure.Interestingly, Joshua is not the only fighter leaning on faith this week. Jake Paul has also spoken openly about prayer. The American admitted he had worries earlier but says those feelings are gone.‚ÄúI did [have concerns about the fight], but I asked Jesus to take them away from me and he did. I literally don‚Äôt feel any fear, so shout out to Jesus and the power of God and believing in your faith. I just keep praying and praying every single day, and I know something amazing is going to happen. This is my moment, the start of a massive chapter for me‚Äù, Paul noted.On Friday night, both fighters will step into the ring believing faith is on their side.Also Read: ‚ÄúI gotta take his soul‚Äù - Anthony Joshua says he knows how to break Jake Paul ahead of Miami showdown
Article Summary: Anthony joshua takes on jake paul in miami on friday night. The fight will be telecast live on netflix and will go down in joshua‚Äôs professional record. Joshua believes the biggest change in this phase of his career is not technical, it is spiritual.

Article Title: Ethan McLeod cause of death: How did the Macclesfield FC forward die at 21
Article Text:
Ethan McLeod cause of death: How did the Macclesfield FC forward die at 21 (Image via Getty)

Ethan McLeod remembered for his smile, hard work, and love for the game



Ethan McLeod, a young soccer player with a bright future, has died at just 21 years old. The English footballer was killed in a car crash while driving home from his team‚Äôs match on Tuesday night. His club, Macclesfield F.C., confirmed the heartbreaking news and said the loss has left everyone in deep shock.McLeod was traveling back from a game against Bedford Town when the crash happened. According to the club, the accident took place on the M1 motorway late Tuesday night. The BBC reported that McLeod‚Äôs white Mercedes hit a roadside barrier at around 10:40 p.m. local time.News of his sudden death has shaken teammates, coaches, fans, and the wider football community. Macclesfield F.C. said McLeod was not just a talented player, but also a person who brought joy wherever he went. At such a young age, his life and career were only just beginning.Macclesfield F.C. shared an emotional statement after confirming Ethan McLeod‚Äôs death. The club said, ‚ÄúEthan was an incredibly talented and well-respected member of our First Team Squad, who had his whole life ahead of him.‚Äù The team added that he ‚Äúwas involved in a car accident on the M1 which tragically took his life‚Äù while returning home from Tuesday night‚Äôs match.The club spoke warmly about his character, saying, ‚ÄúEthan‚Äôs infectious personality endeared him to everyone that he came into contact with.‚Äù They also praised his effort and attitude, adding, ‚ÄúIn giving his all in everything he did, Ethan effortlessly pushed us all to be the best we can be, both on and off the pitch.‚ÄùMacclesfield highlighted how much he meant to the team, saying, ‚ÄúEthan‚Äôs professionalism and unwavering work ethic inspired everyone, and his lust for life put smiles on all our faces even on the darkest of days.‚Äù The statement continued, ‚ÄúNews of Ethan‚Äôs passing has devastated our entire Club and no words can convey the immense sense of sadness and loss that we feel now.‚ÄùMcLeod had been part of the English soccer system since he was just seven years old. According to the BBC, he joined Wolverhampton Wanderers‚Äô youth academy at a young age. Born in Birmingham, England, he later played for Alvechurch, Rushall Olympic, and Stourbridge before signing with Macclesfield in July.This season, McLeod made five appearances for Macclesfield in the National League North and scored two goals. The club, which plays in England‚Äôs sixth-tier league, said his impact will never be forgotten.Macclesfield also shared support for his family, including his younger brother Conor McLeod, 20, who currently plays for Wolverhampton‚Äôs former team. The club said it would provide care and support for Conor during this painful time. A minute of silence will be held before Saturday‚Äôs game to honor Ethan Mcleod‚Äôs memory.Also Read: Cristiano Ronaldo Net Worth 2022, 2023, 2024 & 2025: Year-By-Year Breakdown Of Football Star‚Äôs Rise To Billionaire Status
Article Summary: Ethan mcleod, 21, was killed in a car crash on the m1 motorway on tuesday night. His club, macclesfield f.c. confirmed the news and said the loss has left everyone in deep shock. Mcleod had been part of the english soccer system since he was just seven years old.

Article Title: Top 5 highest-paid NHL coaches: Jon Cooper, Mike Sullivan lead tops salary chart
Article Text:
Mike Sullivan (Image Via Twitter)

How Mike Sullivan and Jon Cooper set the standard highest-paid NHL coaches

The Highest Paid NHL Coach in 2025 üí∞

What makes Jared Bednar, Bruce Cassidy, and Peter DeBoer worth millions?



The topic of the highest-paid coaches in the NHL has come to the forefront and is being widely talked about, mainly due to the fact that the league is becoming more and more popular. The climb in TV ratings and the increase in fan interest to a level that has not been seen in decades have made it clear that the NHL teams are willing to pay good money for having the best coaching staff in place. The teams from big cities are no longer at the stage where they are hesitating to spend a lot on coaching, as they are convinced that the right voice and vision can swing the Stanley Cup race their way.This conviction has been the main reason behind the changes in the salary pattern of head coaches. The information disclosed by sources such as Front Office Sports, The Athletic, and Hockey-Reference shows that just a handful of coaches are still able to command salaries that were regarded as unbelievable in the hockey world not so long ago. These contracts not only take into account the past success but also the growing importance that the teams attach to the art of tactics, controlling the locker room, and making stable long-term commitments.Mike Sullivan is alone at the top of the list after he reset the market in May 2025. The New York Rangers enticed him away from the Pittsburgh Penguins, making him the highest-paid coach in NHL history with a reported $6.5 million per year contract.Sullivan has the amazing credentials of being the coach who led the team to back-to-back Stanley Cups in 2016 and 2017, and the Rangers‚Äô management obviously saw him as the missing puzzle piece for their championship aspirations.The head coach of the Tampa Bay Lightning, Jon Cooper, comes in at the second position with a salary of about $5.3 million per year. Cooper, the longest-serving coach in the league, has led Tampa Bay to four Stanley Cup Finals and two victories, thus creating one of the NHL's modern dynasties with his approach of consistency and adaptability.Underneath that excellent layer comes the Colorado Avalanche, coach Jared Bednar, who takes home a little less than $5 million annually. The very first professional hockey team for Bednar was the Colorado Avalanche, where he has molded the team into one of the brightest contenders and Stanley Cup winners with his fast, disciplined style.Following the mentioned coach is Bruce Cassidy, the Vegas Golden Knights head coach, who rakes in $4.5 million each year. His value was proven when he led the Knights to their first-ever Stanley Cup in 2023, thus justifying the franchise's daring investment.The fifth spot on this list is taken by Dallas Stars coach Peter DeBoer, who earns close to $4.25 million. He may not own a Stanley Cup ring, but his playoff streak and many Finals appearances still place him among the most trusted coaches in the league.The upswing in coaching salaries in the NHL clearly points to a shift in the league‚Äôs focus. Today‚Äôs teams are not just looking for a coach with an impressive track record, but a multimillion-dollar necessity for everyone involved to aim for the ultimate hockey prize.Also Read: NHL Trade Rumours: Phillip Danault, Ryan Strome, Mason Marchment linked to potential trades
Article Summary: Mike sullivan is the highest-paid coach in nhl history with a reported $6.5 million per year contract. The head coach of the tampa bay lightning, jon cooper, comes in at the second position with a salary of about $5.3 million annually. Colorado avalanche, coach jared bednar, who takes home a little less than $5 million annually, is third.

Article Title: NBA injury update: Anthony Edwards‚Äô heath status explored as Minnesota Timberwolves prepare to face Memphis Grizzlies
Article Text:
Anthony Edwards might play against the Memphis Grizzlies (Image via NBA)

Anthony Edwards‚Äô possible return might give Minnesota Timberwolves timely boost ahead of Memphis Grizzlies clash

Minnesota Timberwolves continue their strong run without Anthony Edwards as tough stretch looms ahead

The Minnesota Timberwolves and Memphis Grizzlies, two Western Conference playoff contenders, will square off on Wednesday night. Anthony Edwards and Ja Morant are both listed as questionable for this game on the injury report.The Timberwolves are currently 7.5-point favorites in the most recent DraftKings odds because Edwards is officially labelled as questionable for Wednesday's game. Due to a right foot injury that has kept him out of the last two games, Edwards' questionable designation on Wednesday was attributed to injury maintenance.Anthony Edwards, a star player for the Minnesota Timberwolves, has missed the team's previous two games due to a foot ailment, but it looks like he could make a comeback on Wednesday night against the Memphis Grizzlies.It's still uncertain if Anthony Edwards will start for the Timberwolves on Wednesday night against the Memphis Grizzlies after missing the previous two games due to right foot pain. The official announcement read:‚ÄúEdwards (foot) is questionable for Wednesday's game against the Grizzlies, Dane Moore of 'The Dane Moore NBA Podcast' reports‚Ä¶‚ÄùDespite Edwards' injury, the Timberwolves have won consecutive games and are currently 17-9 in the 2025‚Äì26 campaign, good for the sixth seed in the Western Conference.This season, Edwards has sustained a few injuries. He missed several games early in the season due to a hamstring problem.In an interview with KFAN-FM 100.3 on Tuesday morning, head coach Chris Finch stated:"It's definitely improving. He's still day to day... We have practice here this morning, and we'll see what he looks like coming in. But he was able to move around and get up some shots yesterday. We're headed in the right direction, but I'm not sure of an exact return time just yet."Nevertheless, the All-NBA guard is shooting 50.0 percent from the field and 41.6 percent from beyond the arc while averaging 28.7 points, 4.9 rebounds, and 3.8 assists per game. Earlier this month, he ended a six-game run of games with 30 or more points, but in his most recent game, he scored 40.Edwards would be worth considering for Minnesota's prop market if he returns on Wednesday. My favorite play for him on December 17 is shown here.Edwards' next chance will be on Friday night when the 24-2 Oklahoma City visit the Wolves in Minneapolis if he doesn't play on Wednesday. With two victories over the weekend, including one against the Golden State Warriors in Stephen Curry's comeback game, the Timberwolves have generally performed well in Edwards' absence.In the Timberwolves' second consecutive game without star Anthony Edwards, Minnesota defeated the Sacramento Kings 117-103 on Sunday night thanks to 24 points and nine rebounds from Julius Randle. The Wolves are now 17-9 overall after winning seven of their previous eight games. The schedule tightens with three of the next four games against the Thunder, Knicks, and Nuggets after hosting Memphis.Also read: Anthony Edwards jokes about dunking on Yao Ming during Adidas ‚ÄòBelieve That Tour‚Äô in China
Article Summary: Minnesota timberwolves and memphis grizzlies, two western conference playoff contenders, will square off on wednesday night. Anthony edwards and ja morant are both listed as questionable for this game on the injury report. Timberwolves are currently 7.5-point favorites in the most recent draftkings odds because edwards is officially labelled as questionable.

Article Title: Who is Quinn Ewers? What to know about the Dolphins‚Äô new starting quarterback
Article Text:
Image via IMAGN

From Texas prodigy to NFL

Why did Miami turn to Quin Ewers now?

Also Read:

The Miami Dolphins have turned to an unexpected name at quarterback as their 2025 season takes another sharp turn. Following Tua Tagovailoa ‚Äôs benching after a string of disappointing performances, rookie Quinn Ewers is set to make his first NFL start, stepping into the spotlight against the Cincinnati Bengals. For many fans, the obvious question now is simple: who exactly is Quinn Ewers?Quinn Ewers arrives in Miami with a college resume that once made him one of the most talked-about quarterback prospects in the country. A former Texas Longhorns star, Ewers played a central role in leading the program back to national relevance. During his time in Austin, he guided Texas to consecutive College Football Playoff appearances and finished his college career as one of the school‚Äôs most productive passers.Statistically, Ewers ranks third all-time at Texas in passing yards and passing touchdowns, throwing for over 9,000 yards and 68 scores. His best season came in 2024, when he threw 31 touchdowns and earned All-SEC and All-Big 12 honors across his college career. Despite that production, questions about arm strength and consistency pushed him down draft boards.Ewers was ultimately selected by the Dolphins in the seventh round of the 2025 NFL Draft, taken 231st overall. The slide reflected league-wide skepticism about his long-term upside as a starter, but Miami viewed him as a developmental option with strong football IQ and poise.The decision to start Ewers came after Miami‚Äôs 28-15 loss to the Pittsburgh Steelers, a game in which Tagovailoa struggled under pressure. Dolphins head coach Mike McDaniel admitted afterward that quarterback play was ‚Äúnot good enough,‚Äù signaling that changes were coming. With Miami eliminated from playoff contention, the team has opted to evaluate its younger options rather than stick with the status quo.Notably, Ewers was chosen ahead of former first-round pick Zach Wilson, a move that underscores the coaching staff‚Äôs desire to see what the rookie can offer in live action.At 22, Ewers brings solid size, a quick release, and a reputation for processing defenses well. He is comfortable operating short and intermediate passing concepts and has shown touch and anticipation when protected. However, concerns remain about his deep-ball consistency, pocket awareness under heavy pressure, and injury history dating back to college.Whether he emerges as a long-term option or settles into a backup role, Quinn Ewers now has the chance he‚Äôs been waiting for, and the Dolphins are watching closely.
Article Summary: Quinn ewers is set to make his first nfl start against the cincinnati bengals. The 22-year-old was selected by the dolphins in the seventh round of the 2025 nfl draft. The move comes after tua tagovailoa was benched following a string of poor performances.

Article Title: Marvin Harrison Jr. injury update: Uncertainty looms as the star Arizona Cardinals WR shows signs of recovery ahead of the Atlanta Falcons matchup
Article Text:
Marvin Harrison Jr. is dealing with a pretty brutal knee injury.(Image via Mark J. Rebilas-Imagn Images)

Marvin Harrison Jr. might take the field on Sunday for the Arizona Cardinals after missing the last two games



What happened to Marvin Harrison Jr. as the Arizona Cardinals suffer on the field?



Marvin Harrison Jr., the Arizona Cardinals‚Äô star player, has missed the last two matches against the Los Angeles Rams and the Houston Texans as he deals with a brutal heel injury.As the Arizona Cardinals gear up to face the Atlanta Falcons on Sunday night, all eyes are on Marvin Harrison Jr.‚Äôs return to the field as the team faces a tough stretch on the field. Amid the Arizona Cardinals‚Äô losing streak, the team has shared an update on Marvin Harrison‚Äôs possible return to the field.A few hours ago, as per AZCardinals.com, the team‚Äôs head coach Jonathan Gannon opened up about Marvin Harrison Jr.The publication reported, "WR Marvin Harrison Jr. (heel) will be at practice today, Jonathan Gannon said. It should be noted the [Arizona Cardinals] are holding just a walkthough Wednesday. Not open to media‚Ä¶‚ÄùThis has sparked some hope among fans about Marvin Harrison Jr. being able to take the field on Sunday night against the Atlanta Falcons after he missed all days of practice last week.However, neither the team, the Arizona Cardinals nor the star player, Marvin Harrison Jr. has confirmed if he would be able to take the field on Sunday night against the Atlanta Falcons.For the unversed, the Arizona Cardinals‚Äô popular wide receiver, Marvin Harrison Jr. has had a pretty troublesome time in this season.Marvin Harrison Jr. first went through an appendectomy earlier this season which resulted in him missing two matches.As luck would have it, after the Arizona Cardinals‚Äô star player returned to the field, he ended up sustaining a brutal heel injury in Week 10 as he took the field against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.While Marvin Harrison Jr. gears up for Sunday‚Äôs match against the Atlanta Falcons, the Arizona Cardinals is facing a pretty tough time on the field.In the last five matches, the Arizona Cardinals have witnessed brutal losses against the San Francisco 49ers, the Jacksonville Jaguars, the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, the Los Angeles Rams and the Houston Texans.Though the Arizona Cardinals will not be entering the playoffs in this season, fans are still expecting Marvin Harrison Jr. to return to the field.Also Read: Drake London injury update: Atlanta Falcons break silence on WR‚Äôs potential return to the field as team gears up to face Arizona Cardinals
Article Summary: Marvin harrison jr. has missed the last two matches against the los angeles rams and the houston texans as he deals with a brutal heel injury. The arizona cardinals are facing a tough stretch on the field as they have lost five matches in a row. The team has shared an update on marvin harrison‚Äôs possible return to the field.

Article Title: Why Ohio University suddenly fired head football coach Brian Smith just days before the bowl game
Article Text:
Ohio football coach Brian Smith fired (Getty Images)

Ohio University fires head coach Brian Smith amid misconduct allegations

Ohio University‚Äôs football program woke up to turmoil at the worst possible moment. With a bowl game days away and a season of promise still fresh, the school made a decisive move that sent shockwaves through Athens, Ohio. On Wednesday, Dec. 17, the university announced it had fired head football coach Brian Smith, citing allegations serious enough to terminate his contract for cause. The timing, the language, and the lack of detail instantly raised questions far beyond the win loss record.For a program still building momentum, the decision lands heavy. Smith was not only less than a year into his tenure, he was also coming off a solid season that suggested stability. Instead, Ohio University now finds itself searching for answers, clarity, and yet another head coach as the Bobcats prepare for postseason football under an interim leader.In its official statement, the school said, ‚ÄúThe termination follows an administrative review of allegations that Smith violated the terms of his employment agreement by engaging in serious professional misconduct and participating in activities that reflect unfavorably on the University.‚ÄùThe university offered no further specifics, leaving fans and observers to read between carefully chosen lines.Smith, 45, had been placed on leave on Dec. 1 for undisclosed reasons, a move that hinted at deeper issues behind closed doors. Just 364 days earlier, he had taken over the program after Tim Albin departed for UNC Charlotte. On the field, results were steady. Ohio finished 8-4 this season, building on the foundation of recent success and remaining competitive in the Mid American Conference.The response from Smith‚Äôs legal team was swift and forceful. His attorney, Rex Elliott, issued a statement saying his client is ‚Äúshocked and dismayed‚Äù by the firing. Elliott added, "We vigorously dispute Ohio University's grounds for the termination for cause of Coach Brian Smith. He is shocked and dismayed by this turn of events, and we plan to fight this wrongful termination to protect his good name.‚Äù He continued, "Coach Smith is an ethical man who has done an exemplary job for the University. He wants nothing but the best for the players, coaches, and the entire Bobcat community."With Smith gone, defensive coordinator John Hauser steps in as interim head coach, tasked with leading the Bobcats into the Frisco Bowl against UNLV on Dec. 23. Meanwhile, the university confirmed that a national search for a permanent head coach, its third in three seasons, will begin immediately.Smith‚Äôs dismissal also follows a broader trend of late season upheaval in college football. Just last week, Michigan fired head coach Sherrone Moore after an investigation found ‚Äúcredible evidence‚Äù of misconduct, days before a major bowl appearance. For Ohio University, the immediate challenge is focus. The longer term test will be restoring trust while keeping a once promising program from losing its footing.Also Read: Myles Garrett‚Äôs viral kiss with Chloe Kim leaves her dad hilariously cringing as Browns star chases history
Article Summary: Ohio university fires head coach brian smith amid misconduct allegations. Smith, 45, had been placed on leave on dec. 1 for undisclosed reasons. Defense coordinator john hauser steps in as interim head coach, tasked with leading the bobcats into the frisco bowl.

Article Title: NHL Brandon Hagel Injury Update: Lightning forward exits after head shot by Panthers' Seth Jones
Article Text:
Brandon Hagel of the Tampa Bay Lightning is hit by Seth Jones of the Florida Panthers (Credit: Getty Images)

Brandon Hagel was injured in Tampa Bay Lightning at Florida Panthers game



It was not only a defeat on the scoreboard when Tampa Bay Lightning played against the Florida Panthers, but also forward Brandon Hagel had to leave the field early after getting a heavy headshot. The play happened during a hotly contested match, and soon, it became the highlight of the night.Hagel, one of Tampa Bay‚Äôs most productive forwards this season, did not return after the hit and was ruled out with an upper-body injury. While the Lightning provided limited details postgame, the play raised questions about player safety, potential supplemental discipline, and Hagel‚Äôs short-term availability.The injury occurred midway through the contest when Brandon Hagel took contact to the head from Florida Panthers defenseman Seth Jones along the boards. Hagel appeared shaken immediately after the collision and headed straight to the locker room under his own power, but clearly in discomfort.The play was not reviewed on-ice, and Seth Jones was not penalized. Nevertheless, replays revealed that Jones hit Hagel in the head area more than once, which led to post-game commentary on the part of analysts and fans about whether NHL Player Safety should take further action.Hagel has played a crucial role with the Lightning and contributed a stable scoring and solid two-way play. His absence may affect the forward depth of Tampa Bay as the club tries to make it through a taxing period of the schedule. Until the status of Hagel is clear, the Lightning will have to depend more on their secondary scoring.As of the latest NHL injury updates, there has been no announcement of supplemental discipline against Seth Jones. The Lightning is expected to release. It is additional information once Hagel completes further medical evaluations. Fans and teammates alike will be watching closely, hoping for positive news regarding one of Tampa Bay‚Äôs most dependable forwards.Also Read: Net worth of New York Islanders star Bo Horvat in 2025: Details on his earnings, salary, contract details and projections
Article Summary: Tampa bay lightning forward brandon hagel left the game with an upper-body injury. Hagel took a heavy headshot from florida panthers defenseman seth jones. Jones was not penalized for the hit, but replays showed he hit hagel more than once.

Article Title: Leon Draisaitl proves his worth again as Oilers star becomes first German player to reach 1,000 NHL points
Article Text: Leon Draisaitl achieved a remarkable 1,000 career points in the NHL, becoming the first German-born player to do so. The milestone assist came against former teammate Stuart Skinner, adding a unique narrative to the event. This achievement further solidifies Draisaitl's legacy and his partnership with Connor McDavid, placing them among the league's elite duos.
Article Summary: Leon draisaitl becomes the first german-born player to reach 1,000 nhl points. The milestone assist came against former teammate stuart skinner. This achievement further solidifies his legacy and his partnership with connor mcdavid, placing them among the league's elite duos.

Article Title: Simone Biles sings along with Jonathan Owens in electrifying Rod Wave concert, shares romantic date night with NFL star
Article Text: Simone Biles enjoyed a Rod Wave concert date night with husband Jonathan Owens, sharing glimpses on her social media. The Olympic gymnast also continues to show strong support for Owens' NFL career with Chicago Bears, often sporting customized outfits featuring his name and number at games, even in harsh weather conditions.

Article Title: Buffalo Sabres‚Äô newly appointed GM Jarmo Kekalainen makes feelings clear on what the team needs most
Article Text:
Buffalo Sabres GM Jarmo Kekalainen

Jarmo Kekalainen emphasizes character over skill in first press conference

"Winning The Cup Is The Goal" | Jarmo Kek√§l√§inen Named Buffalo Sabres General Manager | Press

Jarmo Kekalainen calls out Buffalo Sabres' unacceptable effort level

Also Read:

The Buffalo Sabres officially introduced Jarmo Kekalainen as their new general manager on Tuesday. The 59-year-old Finland native takes over a franchise desperately trying to end its NHL-record 14-year playoff drought.The previous GM, Kevyn Adams, was fired on Monday after five-plus seasons of mediocrity. But Kekalainen wasted no time outlining his vision for turning around the struggling organization. His first press conference revealed exactly what he believes has been missing in Buffalo.Kekalainen pointed to Buffalo's depth of talent as a reason for optimism about climbing back into playoff contention. However, the new GM made it clear that skill alone won't solve the franchise's problems.He placed heavy emphasis on building team character and consistency, two qualities the Sabres have been criticized for lacking throughout their historic drought."I think character is the biggest part of talent, and that's the talent we need to focus on," Kekalainen said during his introductory press conference. The new GM didn't sugarcoat his assessment of what he's watched from Buffalo this season.He called out the team's inconsistent effort level and lack of competition in games they should have won."There've been games this year where we looked like it was going to be easy, and then we lost because we got outworked. That's unacceptable," Kekalainen stated."That's going to be something that we're going to focus on every day, because the talent, the skill alone, is not going to get you wins." Kekalainen also distanced himself from Adams, who, a year ago, blamed high taxes and cold winters as reasons for having difficulty attracting and retaining talent.The new GM rejected those excuses entirely while drawing on his 11 years as Columbus Blue Jackets general manager. "Winning hockey games is the most important ingredient," Kekalainen said firmly. "Everybody wants to play for a winner."The Sabres sit at 14-14-4 and are tied for last place in the Eastern Conference. However, they're only six points behind eighth-place Boston and riding a three-game winning streak.Kekalainen acknowledged fans have every right to be frustrated but believes the core pieces are in place. "We have some really good core pieces here. We're close. Now we just have to take the next step," he explained.One immediate change will see Buffalo moving ahead with two goaltenders rather than three. Kekalainen also placed priority on resuming contract negotiations with top-line forward Alex Tuch, who's in the final year of his deal.However, Kekalainen made it clear he won't make desperate moves just to end the playoff drought. "I told the players to forget about the 14-year thing that's kind of hanging around like a black cloud," he said.Kekalainen continued, "I'm not going to sacrifice the ultimate goal for the sake of making the playoffs and then not having any sustainability for our goal as a team to take the next step."Owner Terry Pegula praised Kekalainen's track record of making bold moves in Columbus. Whether that approach finally breaks Buffalo's historic playoff drought remains the biggest question facing the organization.
Article Summary: Buffalo sabres introduce jarmo kekalainen as their new general manager. The 59-year-old finland native takes over a franchise desperately trying to end its nhl-record 14-year playoff drought. The previous gm, kevyn adams, was fired on monday after five-plus seasons of mediocrity.

Article Title: "An unbelievable experience"- Dylan Harper reflects on tough NBA Cup Final loss as young San Antonio Spurs learn hard lessons against New York Knicks
Article Text:
Dylan Harper opened up after SA Spurs' loss (Image via NBA)

Dylan Harper stays upbeat after NBA Cup Final loss, calls it a valuable learning moment for Spurs

Dylan Harper shines in NBA Cup final loss as Spurs struggle to adjust and contain Knicks duo

The San Antonio Spurs were certain to win the NBA Cup after defeating the reigning champion Oklahoma City Thunder on Saturday night in the semifinals. The Spurs got off to a great start, leading by five points at the end of the first three quarters. Regretfully, the Knicks won by 11 points after outscoring San Antonio 35‚Äì19 in the last period.With two minutes remaining in the third quarter, Victor Wembanyama made a deep 3-pointer to put San Antonio ahead 92-81. Dylan Harper of the Spurs now talked about the sorrow following the defeat. After the San Antonio Spurs' 124-113 loss to the New York Knicks in Tuesday's NBA Cup final at T-Mobile Arena, the youngster offered his opinions.Harper discussed the lessons he learnt from his early high-stakes games after the game.‚ÄúIt was an unbelievable experience to be a part of this‚Ä¶I‚Äôm 3 months into the NBA and I get to go through things like this with a great group of guys,‚Äù Harper said.Harper stressed the value of effort and concentration when asked about lessons for upcoming high-pressure games, he continued:‚ÄúIt‚Äôs do or die. You‚Äôve seen the level of intensity rise up for us and them.Obviously, they came out with the win. But for us, it‚Äôs not taking anything for granted; I think that‚Äôs the biggest thing. When we all go out there, we all know that we‚Äôve got to play 110% in order to win things like this.‚ÄùDespite their loss, San Antonio is still among the best teams in the Western Conference and seems ready for a long postseason run. Harper admitted that performing on a platform with such high stakes was difficult. He added:‚ÄúThe mindset we went into the game‚Ä¶ we got away from it in the fourth quarter, but overall we‚Äôre going to take a lot from it and apply it to the next time."The rookie emphasized the team's physicality and effort. He then continued:‚ÄúYou see how hard we‚Äôre playing out there, diving for loose balls, going to get offensive rebounds, just doing anything we could do to help our team win..‚ÄùHarper also discussed how his father, a five-time NBA champion, advised him to maintain his composure throughout demanding seasons.‚ÄúHe always tells me there‚Äôs 82 games in the season. Every game isn‚Äôt going to go your way, but staying levelheaded through it all is the biggest thing he‚Äôs told me,‚Äù Harper said.It's only their second game together, Harper said, reflecting on the team's development. Nothing to get too worked up over. It was undoubtedly a worthwhile learning experience to be on the side. They even learnt a lot about themselves from it.During the same interview, Harper further talked about the challenges of playing half-court offence when important teammates have just returned. He said:‚ÄúVic just got back, Steph just got back, and all of us were out at one time. Finding how to play with each other at a high level comes with time and experience..‚ÄùDespite having seven players in double figures at the end, San Antonio was unable to match the 53 points scored by Jalen Brunson and OG Anunoby. New York also finished the game with 17 more rebounds, dominating San Antonio on the glass.San Antonio's most outstanding player in the loss was rookie Dylan Harper, who led the team in scoring with 21 points off the bench. Harper finished 5-for-7 from long range thanks to his accurate long-range shooting.Also read: NBA injury update: Victor Wembanyama set to play key role as San Antonio Spurs face New York Knicks in NBA Cup final
Article Summary: San antonio spurs lost 124-113 to the new york knicks in the nba cup final. Rookie dylan harper led the team in scoring with 21 points off the bench. Harper discussed the lessons he learnt from his early high-stakes games. The spurs are still among the best teams in the western conference and seems ready for a long postseason run.

Article Title: Victor Wembanyama breaks down in tears after NBA Cup loss as tragic personal news comes to light
Article Text:
Victor Wembanyama (Jeff Haynes / NBAE via Getty Images)

Victory Wembanyama shows the grandson behind the Spurs‚Äô Superstar persona



Victor Wembanyama receives support from across NBA over his personal loss



When the final buzzer rang on the Spurs‚Äô NBA Cup loss, the world saw Victor Wembanyama do something we rarely see from a "generational talent": he broke down in tears. As the Frenchman sat in front of reporters during the press conference, he was more than just a superstar, he was just a 20-year-old boy going through the pain of losing a family member.The tears were of loss, but not for the lost game, but missing the final moments with his grandmother, serving as a reminder that no matter how bright the spotlight, it cannot shield a person from the universal pain of losing someone they love.The New York Knicks and the San Antonio Spurs faced off against each other at the T-Mobile Arena, Las Vegas to decide who would take the 2025-26 NBA Cup home. In a contest of close quarters, the Knicks registered a dominant victory over the Spurs by 124-113, all thanks to their captivating performance in the 4th quarter.The loss obviously hurt, but for Victory Wembanyama, it also brought with it his grandmother‚Äôs passing. As a young man staying thousands of miles away from home, hearing such news just broke the tear dam. During the post conference, Wembanyama was seen incessantly crying and understanding the professional aspect of the meet with the reporters, he apologised and said, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry. I lost somebody today.‚ÄùVictor Wembanyama might be the legend in the making and the core of Spurs‚Äô defensive and offensive force, but in that moment, all the bursting emotions were just those of a grandson who was dealing with the profound void left by his beloved grandmother.As the news broke regarding Wembanyama's grandma‚Äôs passing, messages of support flooded in from fellow players and fans all across the world. They understood the burden and sacrifices that this spotlight brought on him and commended his strength for sharing such a personal thing. The tears weren‚Äôt seen as a sign of weakness but a profound display of strength.Victory Wembanayama stands tall over everyone else in NBA at 7 feet and 4 inches. His dominance needs no introduction, but behind this professional mask lives a young man who is still navigating life in a foreign land. Wenbayamas‚Äôs situation sheds light on all the international players who are far away from their families and are under constant pressure to deliver.This wasn't a headline about a loss on the court, it was a story about love, family, and the reminder that behind every jersey is a heart that can break.Also read: NBA playoff chances: New York Knicks reaffirms championship run with stunning in-season Cup win
Article Summary: The san antonio spurs lost to the new york knicks in the nba cup final. Victory wembanyama's grandmother passed away during the game. The 20-year-old broke down in tears during the post-game press conference. The tears were of loss, but not for the lost game, but missing the final moments with his grandmother.
